page.title: 06Transport-Ringland &Taverham
page.content: {Ringland's}nearest bus service is 2 miles away in{Taverham}and some cycle to catch it. Others use a weekly bus from Dereham to Norwich.{Ringland children <12 are bussed to school in {Taverham}but have to cycle or walk along narrow, winding, unpaved roads when they go to the High School. There are no street lights in {Taverham.}Some children use the busy main Norwich - Fakenham road to get to school but this is also used by heavy lorries from{Ringland}gravel pits. Road safety is a cause of concern to the parish council. We did a{traffic survey}to see how many vehicles went in and out of {Taverham.}Most vehicles using The Street were cars and on the Fakenham Road, there were 338 vehicles going to Norwich and 311 to Fakenham from 10.00 to 11.00 on 17/6/85. Local pedestrians
